entry.title: Correct page rectangle when printing remote iframes.
entry.content:
PrintContext::PageRect() simply assumed that the document had print

layout, but this isn't the case for remote frames. In such cases, just

return the entire document rectangle, rather than the border-box size of

the first and only child fragment, which would typically be the HTML

root, and any overflow caused by e.g. out-of-flow positioned elements

would be missed.



The test included unfortunately doesn't pass, because the web test

runner doesn't support printing of remote frames. See crbug.com/1487479

I couldn't think of any way of testing this with the existing test

frameworks.



Bug: 1486995

Change-Id: I741d7175e62ef20b0d2eb260ad261e7192057da1

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Remove Obsolete ParallelDownload metric
entry.content:
While the metric has been expired for a while; it was actually still

used in part of the content download browser tests. This change replaces

the reliance on the metric having been emitted with a simple counter and

a bug filed on the owning team to clean up that pattern. Functionally,

the existing metric was essentially just being used as a global counter,

so this is just a simpler means of achieving the same result. I briefly

investigated if there was any better kind of path to query the item that

sets this, but it appears to be owned by too deep of a layer to easily

untangle.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Download.ParallelDownload.CreationFailureReason]=expired

entry.title: [GridNG] Return shortest possible grid-lines with <custom-ident>'s
entry.content:
In order to return the shortest-possible representation for `grid-rows`,

`grid-columns`, and `grid-area`, we need to omit duplicate

values in certain shorthand scenarios. This is

unfortunately more complex than just dropping subsequent values, as

they are not always adjacent per spec.



The simplest option here was to drop the shared loop for

shorthands in this case, in favor of specialized methods for `grid-area`

and `grid-column/row` that enforces the order of fallback behavior

outlined in the spec.



cssom_utils.h/cc was added for sharing code.



I updated the fast/css-grid-layout expectations, and now they are

all 100% interoperable with Firefox, finally!



Bug: 1484952, 1484855

Change-Id: I58193f52e66f9a4cc2c372ee47955fcc30999125

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4894897

entry.title: [Extensions] Ensure ImageWriterControllerLacros API factory is built.
entry.content:
The factory for this BrowserContextKeyedAPI instance needs to be built

during Profile initialization. The step was omitted when the class was

introduced.



This issue wasn't detected when this class was implemented because

there are no tests for the imageWriterPrivate API on Lacros. I

briefly investigated enabling the test for Lacros, but it doesn't

seem straightforward.



To make sure this CL fixes the issue, I did the following:



1. Added the API test file to the build for Lacros.

2. Modified one of the API tests to retrieve the

ImageWriterControllerLacros instance and assert it's not a nullptr.

3. Ran the test and observed that the DCHECK in DependencyManager

that verifies that the factory was built was triggered.

4. Implemented the fix.

5. Rebuilt and ran the test again.

6. Verified that the instance is returned as expected.



Bug: 1483219

entry.title: Attach appropriate SBS to Horizontally rendered suggestions.
entry.content:
The change alters how Searchbox Stats are generated when a

Horizontall render group is in use.



Currently, the logic assumes are AutocompleteMatch objects are

arranged vertically in a linear fashion. This creates a direct, 1:1

correspondence between AutocompleteMatch index in the

AutocompleteResult object, and its position reported via

SearchboxStats.



With Horizontal render groups, the relationship changes. Multiple

AutocompleteMatch objects may reside at the same horizontal position.



In order to report appropriate SBS for each of the horizontally

rendered suggestions, the change allocates a single SuggestionInfo

slot and updates its content for every of the AutocompleteMatches that

target this specific slot.



Bug: 1474087

Change-Id: If8dc5f71e71e440e344ba07df1be2a93578b9033

entry.title: Provide a way to assign an identifier to a menu.
entry.content:
This will be useful for testing; especially for dynamically-populated

menus where a specific element with a specific identifier isn't

guaranteed to be present.



This is not a complete solution; there may be other points at which we

would want to inject an identifier, but it does create a general pattern

by which such identifiers could be assigned (e.g. by adding to some of

the existing menu model and adapter classes in ui/ and views/).



Implementation notes:



The challenge with injecting an identifier here is that the submenu is

created by its parent menu item, not the model adapter/runner. Also,

the root submenu is created by a menu item that is never actually added

to a widget; it serves only as a placeholder.



Therefore, the easiest way to convey the identifier to the submenu is

via the parent MenuItemView.



TODO(dfried): need to add Mac support for native context menus. Fix before submitting.

entry.title: Reland "[anchor-position] Support margin properties in position fallback"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 426a7d8727ff4a2767fdd3cb22b5f091888aa39c.



Reason for reland: ensured roundtrip for simple values



- Reverted behavior (PS#1): check layout for all boxes

- Old behavior (base): check layout for boxes with non-fixed style

values

- New behavior: check layout for boxes with either non-fixed style

values or using position fallback style



Original change's description:

> Revert "[anchor-position] Support margin properties in position fallback"

>

> This reverts commit 502912cd04e83f9d1ce1d8df50fc9778b57207e0.

>

> Reason for revert: causing https://crbug.com/1485377

>

> Original change's description:

> > [anchor-position] Support margin properties in position fallback

> >

> > This patch makes margin properties (except margin-trim) allowed in a

> > @position-fallback rule, so that different fallback positions can use

> > different margins.

> >

> > There's also some changes to `getComputedStyle()` implementation to

> > make it return the used margin values from fallback styles. To do so,

> > we unconditionally obtain the result from a `LayoutBox` if the current

> > object is a box. Since the result is available only after layout, this

> > patch also changes all margin properties on boxes to be layout

> > dependent, regardless of the computed margin values.

> >

> > Note: This causes some rounding differences, as the result from

> > `LayoutBox`, which is the actual layout precision, has a fixed-point

> > precision of 1/64 px. Therefore, some tests are rebaselined.

> >

> > Bug: 1475317

> > Change-Id: I4a3e242ceb04413db5348770b5cb666a54a1c9e0

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4819910

> > Reviewed-by: Ian Kilpatrick

> > Reviewed-by: Sami Kystil

> > Commit-Queue: Xiaocheng Hu

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1190240}

>

entry.title: [EditContext] Dispatch textformatupdate when composition ends
entry.content:
The textformatupdate event is fired during composition to indicate to

the developer that they need to apply styles to the text per request

of the IME. But, we fail to fire the event again to clear the styles

when the composition is ended.



Developers could work around this by clearing the formats on the

compositionend event, but for consistency's sake we should fire

textformatupdate to indicate to the developer that the formats

should be cleared.

entry.title: [User Education] Return reason for [dis]allowing promo.
entry.content:
CanShow[Feature]Promo, MaybeShow[Feature]Promo, etc. now return a

FeaturePromoResult, which can be used as a boolean, but also provides

access to a failure reason.



Because the result functions as a boolean, no changes are required to

any existing code.



On failure, the reason can be ignored, or it can be used to determine

if, e.g., the calling code should bother trying to show the promo again

in the current browser, as some "no" answers are more definitive than

others.



Low-Coverage-Reason: OTHER code is debug output and/or severe or unusual error cases that would be hard to simulate.

entry.title: [responsive toolbar] Implement PopOutHandler
entry.content:
PopOutHandler is used in Responsive Toolbar project to force

showing toolbar button when a bubble is anchored to it. It uses

ElementTracker to listen for a view element it cares about and force

showing the button when it's shown.



This approach is more generic than the other approach[1] which only

works for bubble. We can also listen for menu and side panel to show

the buttons for other cases.

entry.title: AutoNeedsBeginFrame: change to opt-in by clients.
entry.content:
Perviously the viz-side behavior is universally turned on

for all clients, if AutoNeedsBeginFrame feature flag is on.

Because some clients (such as video frame submitter,

offscreen canvas) still submit unsolicited frames without

the need of BeginFrames. This CL changes to let clients

opt-in for the feature.



This CL also introduces Exo-side feature flag

ExoAutoNeedsBeginFrame to let Exo use this feature,

currently disabled by default.

entry.content:
Remove:

- BaselineTabSuggestionProvider (suggestion logic)

- StaleTabSuggestionProvider (suggestion logic)

- TabContextObserver (callback for TabContext tab object)

- TabSuggestionProvider (interface for client side configuration)

- TabSuggestionProviderConfiguration (usefulness of suggestions)

- TabSuggestionsRanker (ranking logic)



TabContext will also be replaced, as the backend implementation of a Tab is no longer needed. It is integrated deeply with basic TabSuggestion code that will be refactored, and the new configuration of signals has not been determined yet so leaving as is for now.

entry.title: Settings Split: Add metrics to track settings updates for first week
entry.content:
Adds a set of metrics that tracks settings updates for the first week

after a user first connects the peripheral. This is split amongst

different time periods so we can evaluate our ability to correctly guess

the user's wanted settings when they are either default chromeos

settings, our "guessed" settings (corresponds to kDefault in the

category enum), and when it is synced from a different ChromeOS device.

entry.title: [Extensions] Use absl::variant to reduce overloads for test APIs.
entry.content:
We currently have a number of overloads for test APIs that run

extension functions and returns results or errors. A proposed CL

would add more versions for base::Value::List.



Instead, this CL takes advantage of absl::variant to allow one set

of functions to take either argument and work properly. We can then

extend this to other parameter options if needed.



This CL also does some cleanup to remove an overload that is only

used internally.

entry.title: [Reland][Extensions] Add DNR metrics on per-ruleset evaluation time
entry.content:
Reland Notes:



This is a reland of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4820428



The previous CL didn't account for the cases where evaluation of

rulesets took no measurable time. In this case, we'd then try to

calculate the percentage taken by regex evaluation, which led to a

divide-by-zero and crashed. The reland checks that the regex time

is non-zero before calculating the percentage taken by regexes.



Original CL description:



Add metrics on the amount of time it takes to evaluate the

onBeforeRequest action for a single declarativeNetRequest ruleset.

Since this is (inherently) going to be dependent on ruleset size, and

since histograms only allow the emission of a single data point, we

add metrics for different buckets of rule counts:



0 - 1,000

1,000 - 10,000

10,000 - 30,000

30,000 - 100,000

100,000 - 300,000

300,000+



We also add metrics for the evaluation of regex rules, which we expect

to take a significant amount of time. These are bucketed into:



0 - 15

15 - 100

100 - 500

500+



Finally, we add an unbucketed metric for the percentage of total time

taken to evaluate regex rules.



These metrics will help us evaluate the impact of extensions specifying

many enabled rulesets.



Bug: 1476897

Change-Id: Iabdab978f195b5f4574e18b5d87b7f5a7bbe3dba

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903086

Reviewed-by: Kelvin Jiang

Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1203490}

entry.title: Generate base::FeatureList for mojo feature definitions
entry.content:
Mojo feature definitions:-



```

module foo;

feature kMyFeature {

const string name = "MyFeature";

const bool default_state = true;

};

```



now generate a base::FeatureList to back the feature:-



```

#include "foo/foo.mojom-features.h"



if (base::FeatureList::IsEnabled(foo::kMyFeature)) {

LOG(INFO) << "Going up....";

}

```



Backing features are declared in a `mojom-features.h` file

and defined in the (existing) module-shared.cc file. Features

are shared between non-variant and blink targets (blink runtime

features are not generated).



Features can now be tested in cpp files - other uses will be

added in later CLs.



This CL adds a new file to every generated mojom target - but it

is useful to pull in just the features to cpp code, and gn does

not make it easy to not generate a file from an action.



Tests: feature_unittest.cc / mojo_unittests

Bug: 1278253

Change-Id: Ib4cd4ef933afe76e33e454d0c38028676289dd96

entry.title: Avoid undefined behavior in AudioFifo
entry.content:
media::AudioFifo maintains two signed integer counters for calculating

the current number of frames in the buffer: frames_pushed_ and

frames_consumed_. These are incremented but never decremented, so

after many pushes and pulls they will overflow. Signed integer

overflow is undefined in C++. While this likely isn't causing any

actual issues on the platforms we support, we should probably avoid

undefined behavior when possible.



We could fix this by converting the counters to unsigned, but we can

also use one counter and increment or decrement it as needed. This

class is already marked as thread-unsafe so we don't have to consider

concurrency issues, and since the maximum number of frames is also

stored in an int this counter will never overflow.



Change-Id: Ib8aec86180214d5144b78fc416e943448d2d49a4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903290

Commit-Queue: Michael Wilson

Reviewed-by: Olga Sharonova

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1203479}

entry.title: Reland "[headless] Cleaned up min/max/restore operations on Linux"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 29530f38d3f05b563392c526a7dc01c2b0a01d2b



Original change's description:

> [headless] Cleaned up min/max/restore operations on Linux

>

> When new headless browser window is being minimized, maximized and

> restored by CDP Browser.setWindowBounds() the window size and

> state is not changed as expected.

>

> The reason for this is that on Linux new headless uses extremely

> basic ui::HeadlessWindow which is based on ui::StubWindow.

>

> This CL provides a more elaborate implementation of ui::HeadlessWindow

> that supports most of the standard window operations, including

> min/max/restore.

>

> Drive by: it also fixes Browser.setWindowBounds({windowState:'normal'})

> problem which restores minimized window visibility but leaves the

> window in minimized state.

>

> Bug: 1485920

> Change-Id: Ic2181619b5715251120328c0e266afe1c5530a24

entry.title: Send b64-encoded compressed safe seed to Platform on successful fetch
entry.content:
Currently, Chrome is sending the serialized but not encoded nor

compressed form of the safe seed to Platform on successful fetch. This

was implemented in https://crrev.com/c/4261237.



Instead, send the b64-encoded compressed form of the safe seed so

evaluate_seed logic can more closely resemble the current Chrome browser

flow and also save disk space when storing the seed.



Most of the code in this CL previously existed in SafeSeedManager and is

moved to VariationsSeedStore so the b64-encoded compressed safe seed can

be accessed and sent to the Platform.



One new requirement added in this CL is that the safe seed will only be

sent to Platform if the seed is correctly validated.



BUG=b:300996158

TEST=included unit tests



Change-Id: Iee5aa0f9e2d63df23af357fcbd5131654e268f6c

entry.title: [FLEDGE] Make InterestGroupManager send notifications after DB update.
entry.content:
It was sending some before DB update, some after, which could result in

confusingly out-of-order events (e.g., seeing leaving an IG before

seeing loaded).



This does not touch notifications not sent directly by the

InterestGroupManager (kWin, kAdditionalBidWin, kBid). We could

pretty easily move kWin to be after the update, kAdditionalBidWin

doesn't have an associated DB update, and kBid is currently logged

when bids are made, despite the updates only happening when an auction

is complete and there's no winner or the result is actually used, so

changing when we log those has broader implications.



Bug: 1486606

entry.title: [dPWA] Avoid turning all sync on/off in tests
entry.content:
web app tests implemented two actions, `sync_turn_on` and

`sync_turn_off`, that are meant to exercise a platform-specific user

action to turn sync-the-feature on and off.



However, one cannot turn sync fully off without also sign out, and

from that point of view the tests exercised an unrealistic scenario.

Furthermore, on Ash, it isn't actually possible to turn sync fully off.



Before this patch, web app tests exercise deprecated APIs that allow

these unrealistic transitions, but there is ongoing work to delete or

rework those APIs.



In this patch, web app tests are migrated to achieve something very

similar but mimic-ing a real user action: sync-ing of web apps can be

turned on and off in settings (rather than the entire sync feature).

For the purpose of testing, the achieved behavior should be

identical.



Change-Id: Id97538ebe36c41485af6b646aa3026c4ef8da3d0

Bug: 1219990

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4903795

entry.title: Add workaround for sharding on inheritance class edge case
entry.content:
The existing otool output parsing logic does not factor into test class inheritance. For example, it thinks that PasswordManagerPasswordCheckupDisabledTestCase only has 1 test case, but it actually has 76 because the other 75 inherited from its parent class PasswordManagerTestCase. This is causing skews when allocating test cases to shards, and resulting one of the settings eg test shard getting exccessive test and timing out

entry.title: android: Add ChromeRobolectricTestRunner
entry.content:
A few robolectric tests reset global state between tests manually with a

bit of overlap:



* OptionalNewTabButtonControllerActivityTest (added in 2021-05)

* LaunchesWithColorSchemeTest (added in 2021-06)

* HistoryClustersCoordinatorTest (added in 2022-05)



We cannot move this common work to the commonly used

BaseRobolectricTestRunner because it is in //base, and cannot depend on

//chrome state.



Instead introduce ChromeRobolectricTestRunner, set it as a test runner

for the above tests and move the common init/reset work to it.



Also invoke ColdStartTracker.initialize() and .resetInstanceForTesting()

because it will be soon used in

ChromeTabbedActivity.performPreInflationStartup(), and the tests above

go through this path in each test.

entry.title: [iOS] Move the allocation of the manager to PasswordDetailsMediator
entry.content:
The IOSChromePasswordCheckManager object can be conditionally

created based on which type of context is used to create the

PasswordDetailsMediator object. This CL prepares the code for

potential optimizations by accomplishing 2 things:

- The creation of the manager is now done within the

PasswordDetailsMediator, so that it can now control

when and if to create it.

- The "GetInsecureCredentials()" call is now conditional on

whether the results of this call will actually be used.

entry.title: Reland "[Build] Create Trichrome32.ssargs; add more *_32_* targets."
entry.content:
This reverts commit fbfed598eb002d9cd70f1243352065f776100bd9.



Reason for reland: The original CL was reverted to resolve merge

conflict with crrev.com/c/4904642, which reverts

crrev.com/c/4858642. To prevent more collateral reverts, we're

going to reland first. The decoupling is simple: Replace

"$_main_trichrome_library_apk_target" with

"trichrome_library_apk" (2 instances) followed by 1 reordering.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[Build] Create Trichrome32.ssargs; add more *_32_* targets."

>

> This reverts commit c1ca3e33227d32e94d23af14df8e0a34fcdae9d9.

>

> Reason for revert:

> Collateral revert for reverting https://crrev.com/c/4904642.

> This CL is conflicting with that CL.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Build] Create Trichrome32.ssargs; add more *_32_* targets.

> >

> > This CL continues crrev.com/c/4847552, and add more explicit 32-bit

> > targets to help with android-binary-size bot's transition to 64-bit.

> > Details:

> > * Add Trichrome32.ssargs, which is intended to be used for binary

> > size monitoring when android-binary-size bot moves to 64-bit.

> > * Selects 32-bit abi_filter explicitly.

> > * Change to symbol_dir.

> > * Add required targets (noting trichrome_library_32_apk exists):

> > trichrome_webview_32_minimal_apks

> > trichrome_chrome_32_minimal_apks

> > * Add targets for symmetry:

> > monochrome_32_public_minimal_apks

> > resource_sizes_monochrome_32_public_minimal_apks

> > * Parameterize targets

> > resource_sizes_trichrome

> > resource_size_config_trichrome

> > to accommodate 32-bit builds (keep old behavior) and 64-bit builds:

> > * Use _*_for_size local variables to parameterize.

> > * Change trichrome_chrome_minimal_apks to 32-bit build only

> > * Replace trichrome_minimal_apks with trichrome_32_minimal_apks.

> > * For 64-bit: (use *_32_* targets and *32.* artifacts)

> > * Use new target trichrome_chrome_32_minimal_apks.

> > * Use *32.* artifacts.

> > * Use Trichrome32.ssargs.

> > * Use different symbol_dir.

> >

> > Bug: 1414410

entry.title: Revert "Define an extensions.mojom.ServiceWorker interface"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 14dccee82412b81286653d579b50dc565c85ca31.



Reason for revert: Dependant CL is flaky https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/21484/overview



Original change's description:

> Define an extensions.mojom.ServiceWorker interface

>

> Push the permissions from the browser to each service worker so

> that we avoid racing with the main thread when permissions

> are updated.

>

> Currently if a permission update is sent it is sent via the

> extensions.mojom.Renderer interface and all these events are propagated

> to the WorkerThreads. In order to unblock the ResponseWorkerAck message

> from not hitting the main thread and directly going to the worker

> thread (as a callback on extensions.ServiceWorkerHost.RequestWorker)

> we proactively push the updated permissions on the associated channel

> with the ServiceWorker. This avoids the race that will happen.

>

> This is tested by ExtensionApiTest.EventAfterPermissionRemoved

>

entry.title: FSA: Rename locking scheme and add base::Feature
entry.content:
Removes "AccessHandle" from the fsa locking scheme flag since it does

not only apply to access handles. Now generates a base::Feature. Added

a few CHECKs on the browser side to assert the disabled flag behavior.



Also removes the experimental feature status since this causes issues

with the base::Feature and RuntimeEnabledFeature not being equivalent

in some situations.



Adds a virtual test suite to enable this flag for locking scheme WPTs.

The non virtual test version of them were added to the

TestExpectations to fail rather than setting them to run exclusively

in virtual tests. This is because of a bug with the linting of the

VirtualTestSuites file (crbug.com/1399685).

entry.title: Implement CopyVideoFrameToSharedImage
entry.content:
Right now there few different code paths in code base that copy video

frames to shared images or GL textures, but none of them support all

possible cases.



To simplify logic and future refactoring, this CL introduces

CopyVideoFrameToSharedImage which should support all kind of

VideoFrames.



As other major projects are landing (OOP-C, Multiplanar support), we

will fold of majority code inside this function.



First usages are NaCL and new WebGL upload path:

https://crrev.com/c/4741796 and https://crrev.com/c/4898204



But we'll convert all other use-cases in PaintCanvas to use it.



Bug: 986480

entry.title: Reland "[webauthn] Update dialog focus behaviour"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 44fbe4ec3b0d63de96494fe00a1f85fa9741e6e7.



Reason for revert: Causing build failures -https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/lacros64-archive-rel/71944/



Original change's description:

> Revert "[webauthn] Update dialog focus behaviour"

>

> This reverts commit b03aa6bffded0c7769eb5000db1642d78bc24ec6.

>

> Reason for revert: breaks keyboard navigation on linux :(

>

> Original change's description:

> > [webauthn] Update dialog focus behaviour

> >

> > This CL updates the focus behaviour of webauthn dialogs. Previously, the

> > "primary" control of each sheet was focused, which was either a list of

> > options or one of the buttons. This behaviour was problematic for screen

> > readers:

> >

> > First, it is not recommended to jump to a button that is most likely not

> > what the user wants to do at a given moment [1]. E.g. on the security

> > key activation dialog, the user most likely wants to tap their security

> > key, not cancel out of the dialog.

> >

> > Second, the authenticator dialog is special because its contents change

> > as the user interacts with the authenticator, but the container itself

> > does not. The resulting behaviour is that screen readers will read

> > whatever gets focused next but will not announce the new context. This

> > is really confusing, e.g. if the request times out, VoiceOver on Mac

> > would announce "Cancel - Button" instead of "The request timed out...".

> >

> > This CL addresses these issues by making the title of the dialog

> > accessibility-focusable and focusing it every time the sheet is updated.

> > The modal is still keyboard navigable, with the enter key triggering the

> > default button if present.

> >

> > [1] https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/dialog-modal/

> >

> > Bug: 1347607

> > Change-Id: If59fbd8f2dbfa3eb7a554d6ecd5ad82df29f2879

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4894369

entry.title: Revert "[webauthn] Update dialog focus behaviour"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b03aa6bffded0c7769eb5000db1642d78bc24ec6.



Reason for revert: breaks keyboard navigation on linux :(



Original change's description:

> [webauthn] Update dialog focus behaviour

>

> This CL updates the focus behaviour of webauthn dialogs. Previously, the

> "primary" control of each sheet was focused, which was either a list of

> options or one of the buttons. This behaviour was problematic for screen

> readers:

>

> First, it is not recommended to jump to a button that is most likely not

> what the user wants to do at a given moment [1]. E.g. on the security

> key activation dialog, the user most likely wants to tap their security

> key, not cancel out of the dialog.

>

> Second, the authenticator dialog is special because its contents change

> as the user interacts with the authenticator, but the container itself

> does not. The resulting behaviour is that screen readers will read

> whatever gets focused next but will not announce the new context. This

> is really confusing, e.g. if the request times out, VoiceOver on Mac

> would announce "Cancel - Button" instead of "The request timed out...".

>

> This CL addresses these issues by making the title of the dialog

> accessibility-focusable and focusing it every time the sheet is updated.

> The modal is still keyboard navigable, with the enter key triggering the

> default button if present.

>

> [1] https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/dialog-modal/

>

> Bug: 1347607

> Change-Id: If59fbd8f2dbfa3eb7a554d6ecd5ad82df29f2879

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Fix infinite recreate issue during onResume
entry.content:
This CL updates the AccessibilityState to clear a cached value

when Chrome is sent to the background.



Before this CL, there was a possible edge case that led to an

infinite recreate bug. When a client of AccessibilityState requests

the isPerformGesturesEnabled boolean before the AccessibilityState is

fully initialized, a sPreInit value is saved by querying the system

state directly. If a user has no a11y services enabled, then sends

Chrome to the background, enables a service, and brings Chrome back

to the foreground, then if a client again queries the gestures state,

AccessibilityState could return the old cached sPreInit value, which

in this case would now be stale. With this CL we clear the value when

Chrome is sent to the background to force a re-query of the system

when Chrome is brought back to the foreground.



AX-Relnotes: N/A

Bug: 1487352, 1430202, b/265493191

entry.title: Add contact email for builders owned ChromeOS Consumer EngProd
entry.content:
The WoA EngProd team and Chrome Browser Infra team are working together

to provide signals to builder owners when their builders are slow,

failing often, or otherwise unhealthy or low-value.



This change will add team email addresses to gardened builders so that

owner teams are notified when there are problems with their builders.



To the owner team: If you do not have permission to vote, please comment

to give consent for those builders to be owned by your team.

entry.title: Settings Split: Add syncing defaults for mice
entry.content:
Adds mouse setting default that is synced across user devices. The

default is taken from the most recently connected device and overwrites

the current set of default settings saved.
